greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n = (2-(n mod 2))*p + q + r with p <= q <= r such that p, q, r, 2*p^2 - 1, 2*q^2 - 1, 2*r^2 - 1 are all prime.
comment: This is stronger than Goldbach's weak conjecture which was finally proved by H. Helfgott in 2013. It also implies that there are infinitely many primes p with 2*p^2 - 1 also prime.
We have verified the conjecture for n up to 10^6.
See also A230351, A230494 and A230502 for similar conjectures.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures involving primes and quadratic forms, preprint, arXiv:1211.1588.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Oct 20 2013
